General.text:
Type:
Antifungal
Dosage Forms: IV; PO
Common Trade Names: Diflucan

General_2.text:
Candidiasis
, oropharyngeal/esophageal
100mg PO qday x 2 week to prevent relapse
Candida vaginitis
Uncomplicated: 150mg PO x 1

Candidiasis
, oropharyngeal/esophageal
100mg PO qday x 2 week to prevent relapse
Candida vaginitis
Uncomplicated: 150mg PO x 1

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
Candidiasis, oropharyngeal/esophageal:
> 14 days old: 6mg/kg PO x 1, then 3mg/kg q24h x 7-14 days, max: 100mg/day
Tinea Capitis:
> 14 days old: 3-6mg/kg PO q24h x 6 weeks

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: D
Lactation Risk Categories
: safety unknown
Renal Dosing
Adult:CrCrl < 50, give usual loading dose x 1 then decrease dose 50%
Pediatric: CrCrl < 50, give usual loading dose x 1 then decrease dose 50%
Hepatic Dosing
Adult: not defined
Pediatric: not defined

Serious.text:
hepatotoxicity
seizures
leukopenia
thrombocytopenia
anaphylaxis
steven-johnson syndrome
QT prolongation

Common.text:
Nausea
Rash
Headache
vomiting
diarrhea
Transaminitis

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 30 hour
Metabolism: Liver
Excretion: urine
Mechanism of Action: inhibits cytochrome
P450
and sterol c-14 alpha-demethylation
